data.title: River Phoenix‚Äôs Mom, Sister Remember Late Actor on 30th Anniversary of His Death
data.meta_description: River Phoenix died of a drug overdose in 1993 at 23. River Phoenix's sister, Rain Phoenix, and mom, Arlyn 'Heart' Phoenix, honored the actor with tributes on social media on the 30th anniversary of his death.
data.text:
River Phoenix‚Äôs mother and sister are honoring him 30 years after his death.

Arlyn ‚ÄúHeart‚Äù Phoenix shared a photo of her late son, who died of a drug overdose on Oct. 31, 1993, on Instagram on Tuesday, along with a heartfelt message about his caring nature.

‚ÄúToday marks 30 years that have come and gone since River passed away at the age of 23,‚Äù Heart, 78, wrote. ‚ÄúFrom the first song he ever wrote at five years old seeing a kid being bullied ‚Ä¶ He was a voice for the voiceless and had the courage to use his celebrity to make a difference."

Heart also shared the lyrics to 5-year-old River‚Äôs song: ‚ÄúWhy do people fight, Why do people cheat, Why do people destroy the love in our world? I want to give my life for them, I know it won't be easy my friend. If I could show them God's, they will receive joy and peace from above‚Äù

‚ÄúWhether it was for human rights, animal rights, women‚Äôs rights, racial justice, environmentalism or any wrong that needed to be righted, he was there,‚Äù she continued before going on to quote her daughter. ‚ÄúRain said it so eloquently‚Ä¶ ‚ÄôRiver was not about telling people how to live their lives, he was about doing his part and encouraging others through his example, through his art. It‚Äôs just who he was as a person, his generosity, his spirit, his compassion.‚Äô ‚Äù

Heart continued, ‚ÄúHe was devastated by the state of the world then and even with the many changes that have happened, we are still at war with ourselves everywhere. I often think that he, like many of the young people of today, would be so confused that with all our incredible brilliance and advancements in all fields, we still haven't found the ability to rectify these huge issues that continue to destroy the better nature of ourselves and all that live here.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhen will we be brave enough to transform all of the issues of separation and move on to reparation, peace by peace, in order to live and celebrate our one common humanity? It's not too late,‚Äù she finished.

River‚Äôs sister, Rain Phoenix, also honored her brother‚Äôs caring nature with a video tribute and message on Instagram.

"Hi, this is Rain, and I wanted to honor and celebrate the life of my brother River Phoenix who passed away 30 years ago today,‚Äù Rain, 50, said in the clip. ‚ÄúHe cared so deeply about the planet, the animals and all people.‚Äù

‚ÄúHe really believed that one person can make a difference,‚Äù she added, before ending the video with a quote from the late actor: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the smaller things that make the bigger things seem so much more rewarding. We‚Äôre all in this together. We can all do our part.‚Äù

Rain, who formed and performed in a band called Aleka's Attic with River, also honored her late brother through art.

In her video tribute, she highlighted fan-made drawings and paintings of the My Own Private Idaho actor, and shared more details about them in the caption.

‚ÄúSincerest gratitude to River‚Äôs fans! #givers4river,‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúAnd to the amazing artists who created these images of River, thank you.‚Äù

Like River‚Äôs mom, Raina also ended her tribute with a broader message about peace.

"LOVE is more powerful than hate. We can all do our part,‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúMore love. Less hate. Peace. Peace. PEACE. xxx Rain.‚Äù

River and Rain have three more siblings, Liberty, Summer and actor Joaquin Phoenix.

Joaquin, 49, named his first child, son River, after his late brother, who also made his mark on the world largely through acting, starring in beloved films like Stand By Me, Running on Empty and My Own Private Idaho.

While accepting an Oscar for best actor for Joker at the 2020 Academy Awards, Joaquin paid tribute to his late brother, highlighting River‚Äôs love of art and dedication to peace by sharing one of his most meaningful lyrics.

"I've been a scoundrel all my life. I've been selfish. I've been cruel at times, hard to work with, and I'm grateful that so many of you in this room have given me a second chance," Joaquin told the audience. "And I think that's when we're at our best, when we support each other. Not when we cancel each other out for past mistakes, but when we help each other grow, when we educate each other, when we guide each other towards redemption. That is the best of humanity."
